name: Mai-Fleur's Fox-Hunting Grounds
tagline: Tree trunks covered with whorls and holes having the unsettling appearance of eyes and mouths.

procedural.encounter_notes: Encounters are 1-in-6 likely (2-in-6 likely at night) to be with a Wild Hunt (see 1502) in pursuit of 2d6 fairy foxes
procedural.foraging_results: Successful foraging yields 1d3 portions of Oddy Sorrel (p430), in addition to the normal results

description: The fairy Duke Mai-Fleur (p30) keeps this region of his mortal hunting grounds stocked with a dangerous species of game: a breed of intelligent, anthropomorphic fairy fox, some 100 in total. The cunning fairy foxes attempt to confound the hunters by strewing the forest with traps.

points_of_interest.name: Fairy Fox Dens
points_of_interest.description: The entire hex is riddled with cunningly hidden burrows where the fairy foxes lair.
points_of_interest.entering: Only creatures of 3′ tall or less can squeeze down the tunnels that lead to the fairy foxes' dens.
points_of_interest.interior: Each den is home to 2d4 fairy foxes, dwelling in a network of long, sandy tunnels, cosy lounges with wood-crafted furnishings, little bedchambers with straw nests, and larders stocked with hanging pheasants and rabbits.
special_features: Hidden treasures: 1d6 gems (50gp each), 1d100gp, 1d100pp, and 1d4 elf trinkets (DPB)

roll_tables.name: Traps
roll_tables.description: When PCs move through this hex

entries.description: A random PC must Save Versus Hold or be caught in a trap
entries.mechanical_effect: Save Versus Hold or be caught in trap - snared in net or by ankle and yanked 20′ into air, 1d6 fairy foxes emerge to ambush
Characters aware of traps may navigate around them but increases all Travel Point costs by 1

dm_notes: Characters aware of the presence of traps here may navigate around them, but doing so increases all Travel Point costs (e.g. to search or leave the hex) by 1.
